intro: Rhanteriopsis lanuginosa, commonly known as the woolly rhanteriopsis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial species. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Rhanteriopsis lanuginosa thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on trees or in rocky areas.
